Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas! [holds up dead goose and puts it on Pam's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Merry Christ-[looks up] NO! Why... why did you bring that here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't worry, she's dead. Oh wait. He's dead.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, what uh...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I accidentally ran over it. It's a Christmas miracle!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, get it out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Relax, OK. And because this is Christmas, I am going to roast this goose and prepare it with a wild rice dressing. Do we have any cayenne pepper in the kitchen?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. What have we got here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What does it look like?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dead goose.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And circle gets the square.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Pam] So can you watch this? I'm gonna get my carving knife out of the trunk.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, Dwight, we talked about this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Toby, this is different. He's already dead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Once I brought in a duck. To prepare for lunch. And people got upset. Apparently, they got attached to the duck and didn't want to see it killed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He was already dead. And we Schrutes use every part of the goose. The meat has a delicious, smoky, rich flavor. Plus you can use the molten goose grease and save it in the refrigerator, thus saving you a trip to the store for a can of expensive goose grease.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Win-Win.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Exactly. Thank you, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I like goose. If it's already dead is it so crazy we eat it?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That's crazy. It's crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Dwight, you cannot keep that here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, that is ridiculous. And totally against the spirit of Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Come on Dwight. We went over this, like for a half an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's Christmas Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's a dead animal in an office. You can't...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Toby...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] Please? Please?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Clean it in your car.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I would like it off my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh Pam. Take a chill pill.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Riding a bicycle down the hallway and singing] Deck the halls with boughs of holly. Fa la la la la la la la la. [Struggling to stay on] 'Tis the ... ack. [expletive] Hey! [to Pam] I would like a nice slice of Christmas Pam. Side of candied Pams. And perhaps, some Pam-chops, with mint...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can I help you, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm looking for the toy drive box.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's behind you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK... Well, I need to put this bike in there. I hope it'll fit, with all these little knickknacks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. What kind of bike is that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Umm... I don't know? Average kind?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The tires look pretty worn.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that is probably from the test drive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But the paint's chipping. Is that your old bike, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo, Michael, sweet ride Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. [Michael and Andy do a fist bump and explosion.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes? [Pam holds up a bag] Oh Pam, that is so sweet. You didn't have to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [hands over bag] I didn't, it's from corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Did everybody get one of these?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Terrific. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is going to be the best Christmas ever. My girlfriend Carol is coming to our party tonight, and I have a little surprise for her. [singing] I've got two tickets to paradise! Pack your bags, we're leaving the day-after-tomorrow! Um, taking her to Sandals, Jamaica, all-inclusive. All-inclusive. You know what that means? Right? Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Creed takes toy from toy drive box.] Oh, I think you're supposed to put a toy in the box, Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: And a happy holiday to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Carol walks through door looking upset] [waves] Carol.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Hi, is Michael around here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There she is. A Christmas Carol. Hello [kisses Carol] You're about five hours early to the party. You're such a blonde. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, everybody. I don't know who you haven't met yet, but I think this is one of them. This is my girlfriend - Carol. This is just the front of her. Show 'em, show 'em the other side.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: [whispers] What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Turn around, turn around. Come on. [making a body turning gesture]

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Get outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you get outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If I may say. She's even prettier that you described her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [standing up] Oh, ouch. Michael, I don't think there is anything wrong with the way you described her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I really need a moment alone with you. [Carol heads towards Michael's office.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not as much as I need a moment alone with you. [puts finger on her back and reaches for her butt] Berp.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: What is this? [Holds up a Christmas photo]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is my Christmas card. It's a picture of you and me and your kids on a ski trip, having a blast. Ski-sons Greetings.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: No. See, we never went on a ski trip.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I went on a ski trip.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Two years ago with my kids and my ex-husband.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, but what you didn't realize at the time was that I was with you in a sense. I was in your heart...

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And next to your kids. What?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: This is so weird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't understand?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a bold move, to Photoshop yourself into a picture with your girlfriend and her kids on a ski trip with their real father. But then again, Michael's a bold guy. [Towards unseen cameraman] Is bold the right word?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I think you're a really sweet guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: But, um, I don't know how to deal with, with this thing [waves Christmas card]. And, and the proposal. And I don't think things are going to work out with us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no no no Ok, OK, You know what, you're not thinking straight. You know what you need? You need to think this through in [making drum noise] Jamaica's largest fresh water pool.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got us tickets to Sandals, Jamaica, We leave day after tomorrow. [Carol shakes head in disappointment]. You better find the skimpiest bikini there is.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And it's all inclusive.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Carol. You walk out that door and it is over.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I know. [Closes door.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Psst. Jim. [Jim turns around. Pam nods head towards her for him to come over] Um, hey. I need to give you your Christmas gift now because, well, I'll just tell you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: For the past few months I've been sending Dwight letters from the CIA. [hands a folder to Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're considering him for a top secret mission. There's his application. Oh, and this is where I made him list every secret he promised he'd never ever tell.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Opens folder and reads from Dwight's file] Last year, my boss, Michael Scott, took a day off because he said he had pneumonia, but really, he was leaving early to go to magic camp. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So... here's the gift. You get to decide what his top secret mission is. [Jim smiles] Sorry I didn't wrap it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [closes folder] You know what? Uh, I really don't think I should be doing this stuff anymore, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, because of the promotion.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It just feels a little bit, like...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I get it, of course. OK. [holds out hand for folder. Jim gives Pam back the folder.]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I feel like there's a chance for me to start over. And if I fall back into the same kind of things I used to do., then ... what am I doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'd like everybody's attention. Christmas is canceled.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You can't cancel a holiday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep it up Stanley and you will lose New Year's.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, take New Year's away from Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Carol and I split up. Amicably. And I just don't think it would be appropriate to celebrate under the circumstances.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Will they still air 'Rudolph?'

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's not fair.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [over everybody else's talking] Are we gonna cancel Hanukah as well?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fine! [everybody stops talking] Have your party. Just no guests.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: But we invited guests.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you know what Phyllis? All of your guests would have probably canceled at the last minute anyway, leaving your life a stupid rotten mess.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, oh, oh, it hurts.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It hurts my heart. It hurts my stomach. It hurts my arms.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK, well, why are you laying like that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [moves a little] Thanks. How did you push away the bad thoughts?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Like what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like maybe, the real reason they left was because there were things they wanted you to do in bed, that were, foreign, and scary?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well.. um I, I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And not that you didn't want to try them. Some wine may have helped. Do you know what I'm referring to?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't need to know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael. Sorry to interrupt. Uh, It appears we're one bathrobe short.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Take it from Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Copy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, would you like to go to Sandals, Jamaica with me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's all... [Pam walks away.] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight. Pretty nice robe- [Dwight grabs bag with robe in it and walks away.] Why?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phyllis, I need you to pick up green streamers at lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I thought you said green was whorish.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, orange is whorish.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh, so I had a couple of ideas to make the Stamford people feel more at home. Each year we have a Christmas raffle ... [Phyllis and Pam nod their heads in agreement].

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It would never work here.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Ok ... um, another idea was karaoke ...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: A Christmas drinking game ...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: God help you.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: These are all terrible ideas and none of them are on the theme of "A Nutcracker Christmas." I think you should leave.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: You're kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You tried this out, and it's clearly not for you. It's time to go. Come on. [Angela gets up from seat] Please. [Karen gets up and leaves] Thank you. OK, thank you very much. [Angela closes door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing? ["Goodbye My Lover" by James Blunt plays]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [putting things into a box] We are getting rid of everything that reminds you of Carol.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, what's the haps? [Dwight shuts door in his face.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Carol?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, look at this. [looks through papers] Your old condo closing papers. It's riddled with Carol's name. I wish I could throw this in the box. [Michael hits repeat to "Goodbye My Lover" on computer]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you just buy the whole song?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't have to buy it. I just want to taste it. I just... I just want a little taste of it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, look at this, she saved you two thousand dollars 'cause they failed to report a mold problem. [Continues to sift through papers] But wouldn't that affect the final... How did she? Oh, oh, I see what she did. That is good. Wow. Carol is one smart cookie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Goodbye my lover. Goodbye my friend. [hits repeat again]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is an old adage, but they say when you find true love, you know within the first 24 hours. With Carol, I knew within the first 24 minutes of the second day I met her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I feel like I've been kinda cold to Karen and there's no real reason for it. I mean it's not like she's ever done anything to me. So, I think I probably shouldn't be cold to her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Karen. Sorry about that meeting today, that was really crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, right? I'm so glad you said that. Because, I don't know how those meetings usually go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, usually like that.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Does anyone ever stand up to Angela or..?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think one of her cats did once. She came in with scratches all over her face. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I really liked your karaoke idea.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh cool, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That could really be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You guys do a raffle?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, we do a raffle...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey. [Toby puts hand on Kevin's back, who is wearing the robe and feels it a little bit.]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This should've been up yesterday. [refers to party flyer]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It'll be all right.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Pam puts up another flyer] What is that? [Reads flyer] The "Committee to Plan Parties invites you to a margarita-karaoke Christmas?" There's no such thing as the "Committee to Plan Parties."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There is now. We just started it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, you just can't start a committee. You have to have funding.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What's your funding?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Two hundred dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's ours again?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Umm, two hundred and one dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh right.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [pointing] Hey, a margarita-karaoke Christmas party, that sounds like fun.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, that is not a party. There's only one party and it's hosted by the Party PLANNING Committee and it starts at three o'clock.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Then why are there two flyers?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, I understand that this is confusing for everyone, let me explain. There's a party that starts at three.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: And then there's a way more fun party that starts at two forty-five.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right, and if you're interested in the way more fun party, all the info can be found here on our more brightly colored flyer. [Angela rips down brightly colored flyer and walks away. Karen rips down Angela's flyer.]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I didn't see where it was.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup, looks like the Scranton people and the Stamford people are finally coming together. And that's what you want, right?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I think that's a really good option...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam and Karen. I am ordering you to cease and desist all party planning. Immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: As ranking number three in this office, I am order -

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Umm... I'm number three.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're number four.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I'm number three.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah, no. [to Pam and Karen] You must turn over to me all Christmas decorations and party paraphernalia immediately that will be returned to you on January fourth.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I think I can help here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, good

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: As ranking number two, I am starting a committee to determine the validity of the two committees and I am the sole member. The committee will act on this now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, this is stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Could you please keep it down? [interrupted Dwight] I'm in session. I've determined that this committee is valid. [Pam and Karen cheer.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No no, no, wait, wait, wait [raises hand] Permission to join the Validity Committee.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Permission denied.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. I can't concentrate when I know you're in pain, man. Let me take you to lunch. [Michael sighs.] C'mon, my treat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Nothing here to distract myself with anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's my boy. I know the perfect place, too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hooters?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Benihana. Much classier. But don't worry, the babes are totally hot, too. [do a fist bump and explosion]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, I need my entourage [both exit Michael's office] Jim. Dwight. Ryan. C'mon, we're going to Asian Hooters.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ah man, I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm not feeling so well. I've got a ton of work to do here. MSG allergy, peanut allergy, I just ate there last night. [Michael feels Ryan's forehead]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: C'mon Jim, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. [to Ryan] Wow, thanks for taking all the excuses, dude.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Doctor appointment, car trouble, plantar warts, granddad fought in World War II. Use your head, man. I keep mine in here. [Holds up blackberry.] Look alive, Halpert. Welcome back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bros before hos. Why? Because your bros are always there for you. They have got your back after your ho rips your heart out for no good reason. And you were nothing but great to your ho and you told her she was the only ho for you. And that she was better than all the other hos in the world. And then ... and then suddenly she's not yo' ho no mo'.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So she looks really hot, so I said, "You look hotter than usual today." [to waitress] Thank you. Michael [gesturing to sit down.] Head of the table.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get out Jim. [Dwight tries to sit between Andy and Jim] Actually, um... [to two other people at the table] Sir, I'm going to need take this chair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, just, just leave them alone please. They're on a date. They look very happy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So she looks at me right, and she goes, "I'm sorry, don't I even know you?" After a year, a year of buying lattes from her, do you believe that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't... I can't here what you're saying.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Carol used to drink lattes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [off screen at other end of table] What're you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She would get this little foam mustache...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [still off screen] Carol had a mustache?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I used to say "Hey, got latte?" And she'd say, that's not funny.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [off screen] What are you guys talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She totally got me. She understood that we didn't have to laugh to enjoy --

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael! Repeat what you said louder!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is my job to be there for Michael. How can I be there for Michael if I'm here for Michael? [food is thrown at Dwight's face]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm already starting to forget what color eyes she had. I can't, OK, I'm gonna call her. I am gonna call and find out...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who are you calling?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna call her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Put that away. Put that away. S.O.S. We... I... May day. Haha. Man down over here, [to waitress] we need your help.

Quote.Speaker: Waitress
Quote.Text: What can I get for 'ya?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think we'll start with a round of noga-sakes. [waitress gives confused look]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One part eggnog, three parts sake. Some places won't make it for you though, because eggnog is seasonal.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You should, you should put out salt for the rims [referring to margaritas]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I was just getting a snack.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can have your snack in here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pam, don't tell her what to do! Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think I'll go to Angela's party, because that's the party I know.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I miss the days when there was only one party I didn't want to go to.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So I only use three?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you're using more than three pieces of tape to wrap a present, you're doing it wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: OK. And where to do you get all those cool bows?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I just get those at any party supply place.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: OK. Are you sure I can't use like, the cartoons from the newspaper?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, your mom would love that.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [Karen walks in] Hey. All right, I'll see you guys later. [leaves room]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: He's cute. You should date him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah... Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Looks like you've got a little Nakiri knife action going there.

Quote.Speaker: Chef
Quote.Text: No, it's Usuba.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, I bet you wish you had a Nakiri, though.

Quote.Speaker: Chef
Quote.Text: Actually, the Usuba's the better knife when you're working with this quantity.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nah, I don't know... Still think Nakiri's better.

Quote.Speaker: Woman at bar
Quote.Text: I think he'd know. [Dwight and her stare at each other]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing he's doing is cheering me up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wait for the onion. Trust me. Hey Cindy, he just had his heart broken, you wouldn't do that to him, would you?

Quote.Speaker: Cindy
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, sure you would. Look at you, I bet you break up with a guy every hour. [Cindy laughs and walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You made her laugh. Yes! She totally digs us. [referring to what chef is doing] Watch, watch, watch, watch. [Onions smoke up] Heh, heh? What did I tell 'ya?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're right. That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello everyone. We would just like to announce that our party is starting now in the break room. So... you can come by... .

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have a very important announcement to make... about... your paychecks. Umm... Your paychecks will be arriving as scheduled on Friday. And they will be in the correct amount that they are normally in... Please stand by for a very important announcement... refer..[starts to leave office] for further regarding your paycheck! [runs outside]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [on cell phone to Dwight] I need to know if I can start the party?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael! Hey! Over here, Michael! [waves down Michael with a napkin and whistles to get attention]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This drink... [in audible conversation with Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. No one can hear me. You know what? Start the party.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Did Michael give you permission to do this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [with conviction] Start the party.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Angela slams phone shut and runs back to office.] Also, I would like to inform you that, um, as a special treat, my party will be starting early. In fact, it will be starting right now [opens door to conference room.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Our party is also starting now [opens door to break room.]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [Stanley gets up and walks towards the break room.] All right Stanley. Woo.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good choice. [Kelly drags Ryan to the break room.]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Welcome Hannah. You will not be disappointed.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: Why would I be disappointed?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I said you wouldn't be disappointed. [Meredith heads towards break room.]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Meredith, if you don't come to my party, you will be very, very sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Is that a threat?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, it's an invitation.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We have vodka!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Lots of it! [Meredith leaves to break room party.]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I hear Angela's party will have double-fudge brownies. It will also have Angela. Double fudge... Angela... double fudge... Angela [puts out hands to weigh his options] Hmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Brownies. Cupcakes. [Kevin walks toward conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Don't push it.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Are we taking this too far? You know what, I don't think we're taking this far enough. [Pam and Karen look at each other] What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I got goose bumps.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't back down. My sister and I used to be best friends, and we haven't talked in 16 years. Over some disagreement, I don't even remember. So... yeah. I'm pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh, damn this chicken is good. My compliments to the chef. [points to chef] Which is you! Right? Hahahaha. Awesome! I need some meat. I want some steak. [leans over to neighboring man's plate] I see steak.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me [tries to take away meat with chopsticks] Ah, un guard. [Fights with chopsticks and laughs] Family style.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cindy, Cindy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't think... I love it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I want you to close your eyes and imagine your dream house. [Cindy laughs] C'mon, do it for Michael. He's had a really long day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] I don't know what he's doing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim! Jim! What... What's happening?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, [points to Cindy] she's asleep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh... Narcolepsy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Probably.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now open your eyes and describe it to me.

Quote.Speaker: Cindy
Quote.Text: I... don't know, it has four bed rooms and a loft...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh, now she's up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And she's trying to correctly butcher a goose, but she's having trouble coming up with it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, OK. Cindy! Yo, Cindy! Cindy! Hold its neck back and insert the knife below the jaw. Bring it all the way around, there's going to be a good amount of blood. [Cindy looks confused. Woman next to Dwight is disgusted] Don't let it bother you. Have a bucket there, for the blood... and the innards... and the feathers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, this is different. The CIA thing, that was a prank on Dwight. This is more like a umm... OK, it's pretty much the same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What d'ya think? [to Stanley about his drink]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Fruity and delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: See, I told you. You want one Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No thanks. They're too sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, so what's the status.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Looks like they forgot the power cord.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, you're kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, you guys, guys, um... I'm sorry, but there's a problem with the karaoke machine. [everyone sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well that blows.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hang on little ladies. You don't need this thing, I'll go grab my synthesizer. [Everyone cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: Darryl! Darryl! Darryl! [Darryl exits break room and passes Phyllis]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey. Hey, look, when you get done with your... [looks inside conference room] meeting, you should, uh, come to the break room. We're having a party.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right. Se you later...

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: [tries to break nut on a Nutcracker doll] These nuts are really hard to crack.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Try harder then. [Hannah smashes Nutcracker on top of nut. Sees Kevin take another brownie] Uh uh. No one has seconds until everyone's had some.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You've got to be kidding!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You've got to be kidding. {Kevin takes bite of brownie]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Cold, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Huh? [puts on jacket]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Maybe that'll help. Is it cold in there?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [referring to waitresses] They have been checking us out, all night! I am not kidding!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what we should do?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We should invite them to the Christmas party.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now, you are thinking. Yes. And you know what? Because you have had such a rough day, you get Cindy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you are such mench my friend. [They stand up and do fist bump and explosion]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, where is everybody? I would like them to meet my new girlfriend. [Guys walk in with two different waitresses from Benihana's]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sure they'll want to meet her, too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The least I could do was give some poor sick kid a bike.

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: That rocks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nah, you rock. Tell you what, if you want it, it's yours.

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Thanks! I, I wanna give you something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. [She whispers in his ear. Michael starts to laugh] That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello? I would like everybody to meet my new girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My new girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Where's Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Is he the hot one or the giant baby?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers] The giant baby. Wow, I am so sorry, I had no idea this party would be so lame.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [under her breath] There's another party in the break room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, party in the break room! Let's go, let's go! Thank God! Let's go to the break room.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey, excuse me! Waitress lady! Hey, where do you think you're going with that? [refers to toy she just took from table]

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: I thought I could have it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You can't have it [takes back toy] I don't walk into your house and steal your Hello Kitty backpack.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhh... Shut it! C'mon! Party.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey! It's Angela! [Angela slams door shut, but not before Kevin sneaks out] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're going to ...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing] I want you to know. That I'm happy for you. I wish nothing but...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just think there are two, two specific kinds of people in the world. People who own houses and people who own condos. [turns to reach for pretzel while Second Cindy turns other direction] And... my question to you [points and pulls away other waitress] is do you agree?

Quote.Speaker: Other waitress
Quote.Text: Do I agree about what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you agree about what? [laughs] Wow. You're lucky you're so darn cute.

Quote.Speaker: Other waitress
Quote.Text: What're you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What're you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing] And I'm here to remind you of the mess you left when you went away. It's not fair, to deny me of the cross I bear that you give to me. You, you, you, you, you, you, you oughta know ta know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right [high fives Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Did you have fun at Benihana's?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. It was awful. I couldn't hear anything. [cheers from other party]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I've had the worse day here [turns up Nutcracker music on the stereo. [Sighs. Dwight reaches for and holds Angela's hand]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [Karen and Pam enter] Dwight, you won the raffle! [holds out gift]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No... way! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Open it! Open it ! Open it! [Dwight rips open present. Angela is upset and Pam notices]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Do you like it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Walkie-talkies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can I talk to you a second?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Well the Committee to Plan Parties has served its purpose. We're gonna disband. In the name of Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [holds up rice krispie shaped like a star] In the name of Nutcracker Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Angela, we've been hearing really great thing about uh... your brownies and we were hoping you'd consider merging into two parties.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not sure. Does your karaoke machine have Christmas songs?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, but we don't have a power cord.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, I may have seen it somewhere. [Goes to plant and picks up power cord] Is it this one?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm. Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We'll go tell everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] And if you want love, we'll make it. Swim in a big sea of blankets. Take all your big plans and break 'em. This is bound to take awhile. Your body is a wonderland. [Michael notices Cindy ride up to him on the bike and looks confused] Your body is a wonderland.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Your hands.

Quote.Speaker: Both
Quote.Text: Your body is a wonderland.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll use my hands on it.

Quote.Speaker: Both
Quote.Text: Something 'bout the way your hair falls in your face...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [singing] Whatever we deny or embrace. For worse or for better. We belong, we belong, we belong together... Ryan...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When you know, you just know.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check her out. My little gal over there. Babe-alectable.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Which one is she? [Michael stares at both waitresses]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's... it's one of those two. [points at both]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You don't know?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dude, you should know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah... well, it's been hard, they're wearing the exact same uniform. And I've been drinking. And you know how all waitresses look alike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I honestly don't see what the big deal is. Stevie Wonder is married. Are you going to tell me that Stevie Wonder doesn't love his wife just because he's not sure what she looks like?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Where's my girl? Is she in the fridge? Where is she hiding? I don't know where she is. 'Cause I'm drunk, I can't even find her.

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: You know where I am.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Haha, I do! I just haven't hugged you in awhile [marks Cindy's arm with a black marker]

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, good. That felt good. Let's go. Party.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [singing] Spinnin' n reelin with love. Give it the time, I might come back down. But it feels so good. My feet don't touch the ground. Wha..wha..wild. Wha..wha..wild. Well everybody knows, I'm crazy about 'ya...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [into walkie-talkie] Monkey, this is Possum. Do you copy?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [into another walkie-talkie] Copy, Possum. What's your twenty?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: No way. [both hold up Bridget Jones' Diary movie DVD]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What a horrible, horrible movie that was.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: And now we get to remember it forever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thank you. [Both hug]

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, you. How are ya?

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Hey. This party blows, so we're gonna leave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Hey, you should stay because we are having fun and...

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Cool...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where do you wanna go?

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: I... We're just gonna take off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... you know what? I, OK, listen. I like you. I really like you. So much in fact, that I would like you to accompany me on a trip to Sandals, Jamaica.

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: No... I have school. [leaves with other waitress and bicycle]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You want help? OK... Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] Lady, from the moment I saw you standing all alone. You gave all the love that I needed...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That waitress was the one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. She wasn't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How can you be sure?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, for starters, I've known you as a couple since the beginning of the relationship, which was approximately [looks a watch] three hours ago.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't make fun... You're making fun of me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I guess, I didn't know her very well. I marked her arm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, I put a mark on her arm. [Both are laughing] So I could tell them apart. I don't... I know, I know. I can't believe I gave her my bike!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, why do I feel like crap?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You just had a rebound.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I had rebound? Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Which, don't get me wrong, can be a really fun distraction, but, when it's over, you're left thinking about the girl you really like, the one that broke your heart.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I totally rebounded. Someone else shoots and I take the ball and I score. Well, I guess I didn't score and I'm not sure who's actually shooting, but, whatever. Doesn't matter. It's all good. Or as my ex might say. Domo arigato, Mr. Scott-o.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [singing, with Dwight holding up microphone] Little baby, parum pum pum pum. I am a poor boy too, parum pum pum pum. I have no gift to bring, parum pum pum pum. That's fit to give our King, parum pum pum pum..

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yes, I just wanted to see if, uh you would like to come to Jamaica with me. There's this resort called Sandals. Really? OK. All right. I promise you won't be disappointed. Umm, It's all-inclusive...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [singing] ... Shall I play for you, parum pum pum pum [Oscar and Gil walk through door]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Too soon. [both turn back around and walk out]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [singing] I played my drum for Him, parum pum pum pum. I played my best for Him, parum pum pum pum, Rum pum pum pum, rum pum pum pum.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing along] pum pum pum pum pum pum pum

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bye Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Night.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Oh, you know what? Sorry, forgot to tell you. I intercepted a transmission earlier and it seems that the CIA is gonna need Dwight down at their headquarters in Langley for training and an ice cream social with the other agents.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We should get him a bus ticket. [types on computer] To make his trip easier.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, that would be great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It costs seventy five dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm... Well, maybe the CIA can send a helicopter?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ohh... [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Cell phone beeps] What the? [Reading text message] "You have been compromised. Abort mission. Destroy phone." Destroy phone? [Dwight throws phone off of the roof and walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: William Randolph Shakespeare once wrote in one of his plays, and I'm paraphrasing here, "Love doth be poison." Brilliant. And a lot of people don't give Shakespeare enough credit. They think it was somebody else. A-holes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: When Michael suggested canceling Christmas, I was outraged, not on my behalf, but on behalf of baby Jesus. I mean, would he cancel Christmas because he got dumped or he was two weeks behind on his party planning, on top of the fact that his cats were ill? I think not. I think baby Jesus would suck it up and plan his party.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: We didn't have a party planning committee in Stamford. Somebody would just volunteer to run out to Carvel and pick up an ice cream cake. So the fact that they have a committee here, fascinating.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is ridiculous. I... I've spent so much time, like I always do. And for that little trollop to come in here and throw her own party... Are you even listening to me?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Angela, what do you want me to do?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I want you to tell her to stop, Toby. Am I being clear?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [sighing] Look, it's a free country. If she wants to throw a party...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What are you...?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...using her own money...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And what...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...then she should be allowed to.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No she shouldn't.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: The more the merrier.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Angela slaps Toby on the face.] Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oww.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. It wasn't my intention to hurt you, but I want to wake you up to the injustice that's going on right in front of your face.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That really hurt. I'm writing you up. [Angela makes an angry face] Hey, you are not allowed to touch other employees. Am I being clear?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael was so right about you. You are pathetic.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't care which party I go to. Once you've danced naked at a hash bonfire with the spirits of the dead, all parties seem pretty much the same.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think I'll go to Angela's party, because that's the party I know.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Where would you like the Rice Krispy Treat stars?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: They're Sugarplum fairy wands.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sugarplum fairy wands.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's like you weren't even at the meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm going to the party in the break room, because they have more chairs in there. If I have to stand around a long time, I get real unpleasant to be around.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Phyllis puts down phone] Hmm hmm. [Phyllis gets up and goes to Angela's party]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. You know what, I better hold off. I wanna make sure I don't dial Carol before I get drunk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, really, you're just calling her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know what? I am. I'm gonna call her. That's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [from across the table] Where's Michael going? Michael? Is he sick? Is he choking?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on [phone] No, I don't think I'm asking too much. I think it's only fair that you tell me exactly what I did wrong. Okay. Uh huh. Well that... yeah. Uh huh. All right. Well, could you tell me something that I did right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [knocks on office wall] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hello, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas. [hands over a gift]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. Do you always get presents for your ex-girlfriends?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, we're never technically... um is there.. Is there a problem?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, I didn't get you anything, because you have treated me inconsiderately, and I'm not gonna stand for that anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um That's... That's fair. I'm sorry. Merry Christmas. [Ryan starts walking away.]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [runnning after him] Wait, Ryan, you're not mean. You're adorable. I'm so sorry. I got you a present, too. But then when I got to work, I didn't see anything on my desk from you, so I threw it away. And then Asuncion took the trash out, that's why I think it's in the dumpster. I'm so sorry. I'm the worst. [Kelly hugs Ryan]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: There's no fizz in this punch. Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'll just go get a ginger ale.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, I've got it, Phyllis. Stay. Have fun. Eat your wand.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [talking to Kelly in dumpster] Hey, Kelly, you know what? Throw my gift away, too.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [from inside dumpster] No, you paid money for that CD.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm serious. It'll show that we don't care about material things.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't understand.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly, I'm so cold!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [starts to cry] You don't have to scream at me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Are you having fun in this relationship?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sometimes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't know Kelly, sometimes I look at us and I think...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [crying] Don't dump me while I'm in the dumpster. Just go back inside if you're so cold. I'll just stay in the dumpster. [Ryan smirks]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [both inside dumpster] Did you look over here?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Who's eating all these apples?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And what are these? Are... Why are there egg yolks in here? Aren't you supposed to eat the yolks?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael was on an egg-yolk diet. He's so weird.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Do you think I should diet?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, you're perfect. [Kelly gasps] What? Did you find it?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, I'm scared.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All of a sudden?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Uh huh. Hold me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, honey, here's Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Second Cindy
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He is also in an interracial relationship, so, you know, if you have any problems, you can always call him.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, you're gonna face far greater problems than I can possibly help you with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sounds good. Okay, let's go.
